snippet: An agreement with the steel giant ArcelorMittal ended a tense, two-month standoff that had escalated earlier this week with the threat of a possible nationalization of the plant.
abstract: French government reaches agreement with ArcelorMittal that commits the steel company to investing 180 million euros ($233 million) over five years in one of its three largest factories and avoids the elimination of about 600 jobs; deal ends tense, two-month standoff that escalated with the threat of possible nationalization of the plant.

byline.contributor: Stanley Reed contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: An agreement with the steel giant ArcelorMittal ended a tense, two-month standoff that had escalated earlier this week with the threat of a possible nationalization of the plant.

headline.main: France Reaches Deal to Save 600 Jobs at Steel Plant
